sen.j: 八坂刀売神（やさかとめのかみ）は神道の女神 (神道)で、建御名方神の妃神である。
sen.e: Yasakatome-no-kami is a goddess of Shinto religion, Kisakigami (God Empress) married to Takeminakata-no-kami.
Yasakatome-no-kami is a goddess in the Shinto religion, Kisakigami (God Empress) married to Takeminakata-no-kami.
Yasakatome no kami is a goddess in the Shinto religion, Kisakigami (God Empress) married to Takeminakata no kami.

sen.j: 諏訪大社他、各地の諏訪神社などに祀られている。
sen.e: She is enshrined at Suwa-taisha Shrine and other shrines such as Suwa-jinja shrines in various parts of Japan.
She is enshrined at Suwa-taisha Shrine and other shrines such as Suwa-jinja shrines in various parts of Japan.
She is enshrined at Suwa-taisha Shrine and other shrines such as Suwa-jinja shrines in various parts of Japan.

sen.j: 日本神話には見られない神であり、諏訪固有の神とも考えられる。
sen.e: Since Yasakatome-no-kami does not appear in Japanese Mythology, she is thought to be a goddess indigenous and unique to Suwa region, Nagano Prefecture.
Since Yasakatome-no-kami does not appear in Japanese Mythology, she is thought to be a goddess indigenous and unique to Suwa region, Nagano Prefecture.
Since Yasakatome no kami does not appear in Japanese Mythology, she is thought to be a goddess indigenous and unique to Suwa region, Nagano Prefecture.

sen.j: 諏訪湖の諏訪湖御神渡りは、上社に祀られている建御名方神が下社の八坂刀売神の下を訪れる際にできたものであるという伝説がある。
sen.e: There is a legend that Omiwatari (cracks that form in the ice on Lake Suwa) are formed when Takeminakata-no-kami, the god enshrined at kami-sha (southern shrine building in Suwa-taisha Shrine) visits shimo-sha (northern shrine building in Suwa-taisha Shrine) enshrining Yasakatome-no-kami.

There is a legend that Omiwatari (cracks that form in the ice on Lake Suwa) are formed when Takeminakata-no-kami, the god enshrined at kami-sha (southern shrine building in Suwa-taisha Shrine) visits shimo-sha (northern shrine building in Suwa-taisha Shrine) enshrining Yasakatome-no-kami.

There is a legend that Omiwatari (cracks that form in the ice on Lake Suwa) are formed when Takeminakata no kami, the god enshrined at kami sha (southern shrine building in Suwa taisha Shrine) visits shimo sha (northern shrine building in Suwa taisha Shrine) enshrining Yasakatome no kami.

sen.j: 父は天八坂彦命であり妹に八坂入姫命がいるとされる。
sen.e: It is said that her father was Amenoyasakahiko-no-mikoto and that Yasakairihime-no-mikoto was her younger sister.
It is said that her father was Amenoyasakahiko-no-mikoto and that Yasakairihime-no-mikoto was her younger sister.
It is said that her father was Amenoyasakahiko no mikoto and that Yasakairihime no mikoto was her younger sister.

sen.j: またワタツミの娘であり穂高見命の妹とする伝承もある
sen.e: Another folkloric myth says that Yasakatome-no-kami was a daughter of Watatsumi and a younger sister of Hotakami-no-mikoto.
Another folkloric myth says that Yasakatome-no-kami was a daughter of Watatsumi and a younger sister of Hotakami-no-mikoto.
Another folkloric myth says that Yasakatome no kami was a daughter of Watatsumi and a younger sister of Hotakami no mikoto.
